title.native: 恋は世界征服のあとで
title.romaji: Koi wa Sekai Seifuku no Ato de

description:
It’s love at first sight for Fudo and Desumi, except it was during a battle of life and death. Fudo, leader of the hero squad Gelato 5, and Desumi, the Death Queen of the evil society Gekko, have found themselves caught in a forbidden love—and it’s their first relationship! Moving in secrecy, they live holding hands with one weapon in the other, finding out what’s truly fair in love and war.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: รักเรานั้นไว้หลังครองโลก
รักหลังครองโลก

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Villainess
tags.description: Centers around or prominently features a villainous noble lady.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

node.description:
Houno Satoshi is a Japanese composer and arranger, affiliated with Sound Drive.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/s_hono)

Website | Twitter Introduction Masayoshi Ooishi is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger and guitarist. He is currently a lead vocalist and guitarist for the band Sound Schedule, which is a three-piece J-pop/rock/jazz band. He is also a part of the duo [OxT](https://anilist.co/staff/127401/OxT) (Ooishi x Tom-H@ck), with Oshima Tomohiro. Biography Since making his major debut as a vocalist and guitarist for the band Sound Schedule in 2001, he has left numerous works as a musician. His outstanding voice, which has revealed itself to be capable of touching the hearts of many, worldwide, and while having his performance evaluated by the people, as a part of a new band at the time, he got to appear on music-themed programs on TV, and on numerous unusual music stations, while also participating in festivals nationwide. In 2008, he made his solo debut as "Masayoshi Ooishi". His way of playing the acoustic guitar was said to be a masterpiece of its own, and as a solo artist to debut with that as a reputation, it made it all the more interesting for him. There are various ways to describe him as a musician, some call him a "hand magician", or a "one-person amusement park", some even say it's like watching a magic trick. Not only does he perform live at the country's floorboard, he also performs on the internet on sites such as YouTube and Nico Nico Douga, where he attracts lots of attention from all generations alike, but he's a lot more popular with the younger generation.

__Hobbies:__ making ribbon bows and sweets, writing poems, Phantasy Star Online

[Website](http://www.tamurayukari.com) | [Profile](http://amuleto.jp/talents/tamura_yukari.html) | [Music Profile](http://www.kingrecords.co.jp/cs/artist/artist.aspx?artist=15412) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/yukari_tamura) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yukari_Tamura) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%94%B0%E6%9D%91%E3%82%86%E3%81%8B%E3%82%8A) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@OfficialChannel-eu5sl)

She is a popular Japanese singer-songwriter and voice actress (seiyuu), currently affiliated with Amuleto (as seiyuu) and with King Records (as songstress). Affectionately called Yukarin by her fans, she is also known for her soft voice and interest in Lolita fashion. She made her debut as a voice actress in 1997, releasing her debut single Yuuki wo Kudasai on March 26, 1997.
While also a well-known seiyuu, several of her releases have been used as opening and ending themes for anime series, while some have reached the Oricon top 100 singles and album charts. Her role as Takamachi Nanoha in the Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha series contributed to a rise in her popularity, as several of her singles (Little Wish: Lyrical Step, Spiritual Garden, Hoshizora no Spica, Beautiful Amulet) were used as the ending themes for the franchise's anime adaptations.

Non-Anime Roles
- Nahida (Genshin Impact) [VG]
- Qiqi (Genshin Impact) [VG]
- Theresa Apocalypse (Honkai Impact 3rd) [VG]
- Vita Clotilde - The Legend of Heroes Series [VG]
- Yvette - Strinova [VG]

[Website](https://dialogue-music.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/DIALOGUE_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/dialogue_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/DIALOGUEOfficialChannel) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@dialogue_official)

DIALOGUE+ is a voice actress unit composed of the following members:

- [Yurina Uchiyama](https://anilist.co/staff/204404/Yurina-Uchiyama)
- [Nene Hieda](https://anilist.co/staff/163903/Nene-Hieda)
- [Kyouka Moriya](https://anilist.co/staff/164774/Kyouka-Moriya)
- [Yuuna Ogata](https://anilist.co/staff/190470/Yuuna-Ogata)
- [Ayaka Takamura](https://anilist.co/staff/204409/Ayaka-Takamura)
- [Satsuki Miyahara](https://anilist.co/staff/204411/Satsuki-Miyahara)
- [Mayu Iizuka](https://anilist.co/staff/166401/Mayu-Iizuka)
- [Manatsu Murakami](https://anilist.co/staff/204420/Manatsu-Murakami)

Jad is an American voice actress and ADR director who works for Funimation and Sentai Filmworks. Her name is an acronym of her parents' names, Jimmy and David, and is pronounced as Jade. Her singing led to her first voice role in Sasami: Magical Girls Club as Eimi Mori, and her first major voice role was Masako Hara in Ghost Hunt. She graduated summa cum laude from Texas Wesleyan University with a Bachelor of Arts in Music in 2005.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Instagram](http://www.instagram.com/leonardosanthos) | [Twitter](http://www.twitter.com/leonardosanthos) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/leonardosanthos) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@FalaCritica) | [Twitch](http://www.twitch.tv/FalaCritica)

Leonardo Santhos is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, and streamer.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Blitzcrank, the Great Steam Golem / Kog'Maw, The Mouth of the Abyss / Vel'Koz, the Eye of the Void / Wukong, the Monkey King (League of Legends)
- Pierce Wheels (Ben 10: Alien Force)
- Peter "Pete" Devin / Master Carter (BONDiNG)
- Agent Bratcher (Outer Banks)
- Henrich Zemo / Baron Zemo (1st voice; The Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes)
- Soren (The Dragon Prince)
- Myst (Grand Chase: Dimensional Chaser)
- Spartan Jared Miller (Halo 4)
- Tetsuya Fukazawa (Ju-On: Origins)
- Kyd Miller (1st voice - 10th season; The X-Files)
- Onix (Gears of War: Judgement)
!~
Masato Nakayama is a composer and former member of the music production group Elements Garden.

Affiliated with [APDREAM](https://anilist.co/studio/6572/APDREAM).

_Note: Not to be confused with [山田航平](https://anilist.co/staff/296698/Kouhei-Yamada)._

__Likes:__ Fried Chicken and Clams
__Dislikes:__ Tomatoes and Natto

__Introduction:__
Tomoya Tabuchi is a Japanese musician, lyricist, bassist, composer and arranger. He is in charge of the bass and chorus for the three-piece rock band [UNISON SQUARE GARDEN](https://anilist.co/staff/119406/Unison-Square-Garden), and for the rock band [THE KEBABS](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/THE_KEBABS), he also takes part in the [Q-MHz](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Q-MHz) music production team.

__Biography:__
Tomoya is the same age as the two other UNISON SQUARE GARDEN members, Kousuke Saito (斎藤宏介) who is also a high school and university classmate, and Suzuki Takao (鈴木貴雄) who is an elementary school classmate. In elementary school, he was obsessed with soccer, to the point that he'd become a "soccer boy". His future dream at the time, was to become a junior league soccer player. Band member Suzuki Takao participated in the same soccer club, as well. When he was in fifth grade of elementary school, he had to move from Funabashi City, Chiba to Setagaya-ku, Tokyo due to his father's work.

In later years he graduated from the Faculty of Political Science and Economics at Waseda University. His specialized field is finance theory.
Takayuki Murasaki is a production assistant.
